poem:
Title: "On Perturbed Crossings"

In the boardrooms of power, ink-black decisions fall,
Chiselling hours into an ocean sprung from children's dreams,
While workers knot hands across the chasm, a fragile call.
Heart-rooted canopies brushed apart by cold regimes,
Parents making a love-or-life lament at night's pall. 
Yet, Love remaps the earth, each heartbeat in streams,
Quiet but mighty as the tides, lifting all.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
